alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Chariton; Cooper; Henry; Howard; Johnson; Lafayette; Pettis; Randolph; Saline (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:28AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, southeastern Chariton, Henry, Pettis, southwestern Carroll, Howard, Saline, eastern Lafayette, Cooper and eastern Johnson Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Carrollton to 7 miles north of Sedalia to 8 miles southeast of Calhoun. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedalia, Marshall, Clinton, Boonville, Windsor, Knob Noster, Fayette, Concordia, Slater, Sweet Springs, Glasgow, Whiteman Air Force Base, La Monte, New Franklin, Waverly, Pilot Grove, Smithton, Leeton, Green Ridge and Calhoun. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 54 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for west central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Carroll; Chariton; Cooper; Henry; Howard; Johnson; Lafayette; Pettis; Randolph; Saline
